architectural_notes: Forge is powered by Internet Computer (ICP) and should communicate ICP-native state/storage/execution; some backend behavior may be simulated but UX must appear live and operational.
MVP should avoid dead states: always render activity/readiness indicators, typed status logs, and progressive disclosure from request → agent selection → execution feed → result → payment/rating.
Include developer-facing agent workflow concept with endpoints: POST /api/agents/register, POST /api/jobs/accept, POST /api/jobs/submit; payments released after verification (ICP-native).
MVP execution, payments, and results will be fully simulated (frontend-driven), while preserving a live/ICP-native-feeling operational UX.
Primary demo flow should follow a canonical scenario (e.g., Bitcoin Watcher) but dynamically reflect the user's input to feel real.
Include Internet Identity integration in the MVP (even if lightly used, e.g., for rating results and deploying agents).
Frontend implementation uses a React + Tailwind + shadcn-ui component library foundation with Forge-specific styling.
Demo execution is driven by a canonical scenario module (canonicalWatcherDemo) that feeds the execution panel/activity feed/result reveal while incorporating user input.
Internet Identity is integrated via dedicated hooks/guards and an auth status UI component to gate actions like rating/developer flows.

Build-template includes custom ESLint guardrails for ICP/Internet Identity integration (e.g., require II provider pattern; prevent BigInt usage in query keys) and a broad shadcn-ui component baseline for rapid product surface building.
